ios.subtitle: Roll the Dice, Pass Go & Win

name: Ticket to RideÂ® The Board Game
Tsuro - The Game of the Path

editorialNotes.standard: This gorgeous digital board game couldnât be any simpler to learn, but true mastery lies at the end of a long and winding path. As fans of Tsuroâs tabletop incarnation, we love how faithfullyâand beautifullyâthe experience is re-created here. App-exclusive ways to play add new layers of depth, letting us get lost for hours among these tricky, twisty trails.

editorialNotes.short: Game 14. Explore an ancient, mysterious world.
editorialNotes.tagline: Game 14. Explore an ancient, mysterious world.

name: The Very Hungry Caterpillar â Play & Explore
Abby Monkey Basic Skills Pre K
artistName: 22LEARN Toddler and Baby Learning Games, LLC

editorialNotes.standard: If you can doodle, you can play this one-of-a-kind Apple Design Award winner. Just draw a lineâany lineâand watch it spring to life across the screen, following your gestures to collect coloured dots and avoid black holes. But as the holes form increasingly elaborate obstacles, only the most ingenious doodles will do. With endless solutions to every challenge, itâs a stylish, supremely satisfying test of your creativity and puzzle-solving prowess.

Ancient Egyptians loved cats, Metallica hasnât played the Super Bowl, and the Ganges is Indiaâs largest riverâall our useless knowledge is now coming in handy thanks to Trivia Crack. This bite-sized trivia game is totally irresistible, whether weâre dominating our Facebook friends in classic mode, trouncing strangers in the 12-question challenge mode, or just sneaking in a game on our Apple Watch. With its cute characters, heaps of unlockable achievements, and a massive variety of questions, we simply canât get enough.

This absorbing puzzler is so minimalist thereâs no start screen, no logos, no instructionsâit just begins. We quickly got lost in the challenge of rearranging tiles, Rubikâs Cubeâstyle, so a single line runs through each pattern. Our advice: sort out the corners and other unique tiles first, then the rest will snap quickly into place.

ios.subtitle: The family game of your life!

editorialNotes.standard: After a long day at work, itâs bath time! But Swampyâs shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.Â

editorialNotes.short: Get married, raise some kids - but don't give away that you're an octopus.

ios.subtitle: Adopt a family in your pocket!

editorialNotes.standard: Scurry to victory with mountains of cheese by stealing from friends and evading the mousetrap in this lively digital re-imagining of the popular board game.

ios.subtitle: pat pet cat, kids animal sim 2

editorialNotes.standard: A rare kind of triumph, Prune takes a simple ideaâpruning treesâand shapes it into a creative, deeply playable puzzle game. The visuals echo the style of Japanese painting in striking fashion, and the beautiful music instills a contemplative tone as you swipe to trim the limbs of a rapidly growing tree and guide it around obstacles. Thereâs no frantic pace, no demanding skills to masterâonly a quietly bewitching and unforgettable experience.
editorialNotes.short: A contemplative and creative experience - trimming trees has never been so beautiful.

editorialNotes.standard: Baffling and wonderfully weird, Samorost 3 is so different from everyday adventure games that itâs impossible to describe what this amazing experience is actually like. We stumbled across brain teasers entirely by accident as we explored its eerie and beautiful world. There was no pressure to do anything other than marvel at what we foundâwhich was easy.
editorialNotes.short: Wonderfully weird, this game blends adventure and brain teasers.

editorialNotes.standard: This wonderfully crafted puzzler is the very opposite of a frantic shoot-âem-up. Immersed in a calm universe, you unfold geometric shapes and line up patterns of dots by sliding them along rods on their faces to unlock the next level. The game looks and sounds gorgeous, and donât let the super-easy early levels fool you: later ones are sneaky!

editorialNotes.standard: This variety-packed sequel knows how to party, with superb updates to series classics like Fibbage and a new reality TV game where you vote off friends.

name: Clever Keyboard: ABC Learning Game For Kids
Chess and Mate learn and play

editorialNotes.tagline: Keep the shop in top shape

editorialNotes.standard: Zipping down snowy hills, trying to stay ahead of a massive avalancheâthe pressureâs always on in this infinite-racing classic. And we love that whirlwind pace, fuelled by landing backflips and hitching rides on penguins, snowmobiles and yetis. From the gameâs masterful one-touch controls to its cheery music, every aspect feels perfectly tuned to keep you playing through long afternoons and late nights.

What secrets lie in the shadows of this Apple Design Awardâwinning puzzler? By twisting and turning unfathomable objects, you cast shadows on beautifully rendered backgrounds; manipulate them just right and youâll find shapes youâd never have expectedâfrom rabbits to wrenches. Soothing ambient music and thematic backdrops make completing each challenge as much meditation as entertainmentâwhile timers and achievements give each level a competitive feel.
editorialNotes.short: With stunning visuals and satisfying solutions, this game is one to savour.

editorialNotes.standard: Ski Safari returns with an all-new look and the same addictive gameplay. Now you can hit the slopes as Sven's sister, Evana, boot up with a snowboard and unlock all sorts of new power-ups. To outrun an impending avalanche youâll need to crash through cabins, team up with Yetis and eagles and perform tons of tricks. The gameplay is as fast-paced as ever, and a fresh multiplayer mode and colourful new worlds to explore (like a prehistoric volcano) will keep you cruising down these mountains for a long time.
editorialNotes.short: Hit the slopes and outrun the avalanche.

ios.subtitle: Be a chef and cook food!

editorialNotes.standard: With no time limit, youâre free to relax and fully explore every level in this hidden object game and discover all the secrets, like tapping on a snake to pop a chicken out of its mouth.
editorialNotes.short: Search for hidden people and objects in detailed, hand-drawn landscapes.

editorialNotes.tagline: Now with an infinite game mode
editorialNotes.standard: At a glance, hocus doesnât look very complicated. You swipe to move a red cube along a latticework of plain grey beams. But donât let the minimalist visuals fool youâthe gameâs intelligent, abstract puzzles force you to look at things in a new way, like a cubist translation of Monument Valley. As you progress, the levels quickly get complex. But the peaceful music and crisp design make spending time in its world a richly rewarding experience.

editorialNotes.short: Guide this charming couple on their trip to collect memories.

ios.subtitle: A tale of five tree creatures

editorialNotes.standard: You might get stuck the first time you play Gorogoa. But once the gears of your brain settle into the right configurations, youâll see how smart this mix of art and perspective really is. Layers pile upon layers, doors transport you between realities, strange creatures and wild environments blend together into a fascinating interactive collage youâll want to peel apart to discover what lies underneath.

editorialNotes.short: Atmospheric art, a moving story, and an incredibly strong girl.

ios.subtitle: Roll the ball from cat to cat
